H0.text: Water molecules moving apart are the main reason a pan containing hot water left on the counter becomes cool.

H1.text: Cold air penetrating the hot water is the main cause of a pan containing hot water left on the counter cooling.

H2.text: Heat from the water moving into the cooler air is the main reason the pan containing hot water left on the counter becomes cool.

H3.text: Hot water reacting with the metal pan is the main reason a pan containing hot water left on the counter becomes cool.

A4.text: Such spontaneous heat transfer always occurs from a region of high temperature to another region of lower temperature

A5.text: Heat convection occurs when the bulk flow of a fluid (gas or liquid) carries its heat through the fluid
